verses.verse: A Psalm of David<WH1732>. Plead<WH7378> my cause, O LORD<WH3068>, with them that strive<WH3401> with me: fight<WH3898> against them that fight<WH3898> against me.
Take hold<WH2388> of shield<WH4043> and buckler<WH6793>, and stand up<WH6965> for mine help<WH5833>.
Draw out<WH7324> also the spear<WH2595>, and stop<WH5462> the way against<WH7125> them that persecute<WH7291> me: say<WH559> unto my soul<WH5315>, I am thy salvation<WH3444>.

Let them be confounded<WH954> and put to shame<WH3637> that seek<WH1245> after my soul<WH5315>: let them be turned<WH5472> back<WH268> and brought to confusion<WH2659> that devise<WH2803> my hurt<WH7451>.
Let them be as chaff<WH4671> before<WH6440> the wind<WH7307>: and let the angel<WH4397> of the LORD<WH3068> chase<WH1760> them.
Let their way<WH1870> be dark<WH2822> and slippery<WH2519>: and let the angel<WH4397> of the LORD<WH3068> persecute<WH7291> them. dark: Heb. darkness and slipperiness
For without cause<WH2600> have they hid<WH2934> for me their net<WH7568> in a pit<WH7845>, which without cause<WH2600> they have digged<WH2658> for my soul<WH5315>.

Let destruction<WH7722> come<WH935> upon him at unawares<WH3045> <WH3808>; and let his net<WH7568> that he hath hid<WH2934> catch<WH3920> himself: into that very destruction<WH7722> let him fall<WH5307>. at: Heb. which he knoweth not of
And my soul<WH5315> shall be joyful<WH1523> in the LORD<WH3068>: it shall rejoice<WH7797> in his salvation<WH3444>.

All my bones<WH6106> shall say<WH559>, LORD<WH3068>, who is like unto thee, which deliverest<WH5337> the poor<WH6041> from him that is too strong<WH2389> for him, yea, the poor<WH6041> and the needy<WH34> from him that spoileth<WH1497> him?
False<WH2555> witnesses<WH5707> did rise up<WH6965>; they laid to my charge<WH7592> things that I knew<WH3045> not. False: Heb. Witnesses of wrong they: Heb. they asked me
They rewarded<WH7999> me evil<WH7451> for good<WH2896> to the spoiling<WH7908> of my soul<WH5315>. spoiling: Heb. depriving

But as for me, when they were sick<WH2470>, my clothing<WH3830> was sackcloth<WH8242>: I humbled<WH6031> my soul<WH5315> with fasting<WH6685>; and my prayer<WH8605> returned<WH7725> into mine own bosom<WH2436>. humbled: or, afflicted

I behaved<WH1980> myself as though he had been my friend<WH7453> or brother<WH251>: I bowed down<WH7817> heavily<WH6937>, as one that mourneth<WH57> for his mother<WH517>. behaved myself: Heb. walked as though: Heb. as a friend, as a brother to me

But in mine adversity<WH6761> they rejoiced<WH8055>, and gathered themselves together<WH622>: yea, the abjects<WH5222> gathered themselves together<WH622> against me, and I knew<WH3045> it not; they did tear<WH7167> me, and ceased<WH1826> not: adversity: Heb. halting
With hypocritical<WH2611> mockers<WH3934> in feasts<WH4580>, they gnashed<WH2786> upon me with their teeth<WH8127>.
Lord<WH136>, how long wilt thou look on<WH7200>? rescue<WH7725> my soul<WH5315> from their destructions<WH7722>, my darling<WH3173> from the lions<WH3715>. darling: Heb. only one
I will give thee thanks<WH3034> in the great<WH7227> congregation<WH6951>: I will praise<WH1984> thee among much<WH6099> people<WH5971>. much: Heb. strong

Let not them that are mine enemies<WH341> wrongfully<WH8267> rejoice<WH8055> over me: neither let them wink<WH7169> with the eye<WH5869> that hate<WH8130> me without a cause<WH2600>. wrongfully: Heb. falsely
For they speak<WH1696> not peace<WH7965>: but they devise<WH2803> deceitful<WH4820> matters<WH1697> against them that are quiet<WH7282> in the land<WH776>.
Yea, they opened their mouth<WH6310> wide<WH7337> against me, and said<WH559>, Aha<WH1889>, aha<WH1889>, our eye<WH5869> hath seen<WH7200> it.
This thou hast seen<WH7200>, O LORD<WH3068>: keep not silence<WH2790>: O Lord<WH136>, be not far<WH7368> from me.
Stir up<WH5782> thyself, and awake<WH6974> to my judgment<WH4941>, even unto my cause<WH7379>, my God<WH430> and my Lord<WH136>.
Judge<WH8199> me, O LORD<WH3068> my God<WH430>, according to thy righteousness<WH6664>; and let them not rejoice<WH8055> over me.
Let them not say<WH559> in their hearts<WH3820>, Ah<WH1889>, so would we have it<WH5315>: let them not say<WH559>, We have swallowed him up<WH1104>. Ah: Heb. Ah, ah, our soul

Let them be ashamed<WH954> and brought to confusion<WH2659> together<WH3162> that rejoice<WH8056> at mine hurt<WH7451>: let them be clothed<WH3847> with shame<WH1322> and dishonour<WH3639> that magnify<WH1431> themselves against me.

Let them shout for joy<WH7442>, and be glad<WH8055>, that favour<WH2655> my righteous cause<WH6664>: yea, let them say<WH559> continually<WH8548>, Let the LORD<WH3068> be magnified<WH1431>, which hath pleasure<WH2655> in the prosperity<WH7965> of his servant<WH5650>. righteous: Heb. righteousness
And my tongue<WH3956> shall speak<WH1897> of thy righteousness<WH6664> and of thy praise<WH8416> all the day<WH3117> long.
